Articles.Content:
The Crow is a drone jet that can achieve hypersonic speeds EASILY. It can lift off on 35 m/s and (seriously) usually accidentally goes mach on cruise. This jet is still not totally developed, so feel free to !

odify this craft then repost it on this thread. 

I have added a folder, including versions of the crow with drop tanks. All downloads are in the folder.

Photos are below.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/IvjDO)

THIS is the download link.

Please give me some feedback!

[https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B2Sxz_Z8rlt2fjlDRXYxVkwxelBMQXFLcGZ xODZtT3EyM2ZKazRsZ25SMUg0YjI1MEx3NEE&usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B2Sxz_Z8rlt2fjlDRXYxVkwxelBMQXFLcGZ)

adding some explanation
Could you post some pics? Most people won't download without pics.

No pics tends to encourage me to download things out of curiosity lol

OP IMGUR is a good site for hosting images, you just copy the image and paste the link in the "insert image" tab

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T00:22:03Z" title="05/07/2015 12:22  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by Goodle...**

That thing is fat. It reminds me of the A-7e Corsair II... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![A-7E_VA-72_on_USS_America_(CV-66)_Apr_1986.JPEG](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/A-7E_VA-72_on_USS_America_(CV-66)_Apr_1986.JPEG)

![A7E_VA22_CV63.JPEG](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e3/A7E_VA22_CV63.JPEG)

I love the "two layer design" type thing. I would fanboy around an Su 27 for example. INTAKESONTHEBOTTOMFUSELAGEINTHEMIDDLEERMAGHERD
Thanks! will make more varients of this craft. look for updates!
I dont think thats a drone... I see a cockpit.![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) Although kerbals are basicly drones.
its a victim pod. the kerbal is used to observe effects of high gees. he does not have any control.
Also, we are endorsed by Zoeiska and The FIST company!

I really like the look of the underside. But I think the cockpit and front intake should be molded together a bit more to improve asthetics and aerodynamics. Good work in general!

Oh! I didn't know this was still active.

Specifics? Constraints?
